sentences.en: He came over well — perhaps a little pompous, but nevertheless honest and straightforward.
sentences.cn: 他给人的印象很好，可能显得有点自大，不过还是很诚实和直率。

sentences.en: He is a good man underneath his pompous appearance.
sentences.cn: 他的外表虽傲慢,其实是个好人.

sentences.en: He is a great, pompous bladder of a man.
sentences.cn: 他是个极其浮夸而且喜欢吹嘘的人.

sentences.en: He is a harsh man, at once pompous and officious.
sentences.cn: 他是个严酷的人, 既自负又爱管闲事.

sentences.en: He was generally disliked and regarded as a pompous ass.
sentences.cn: 他常不招人待见，而且被看作是个自负的大傻帽儿。

sentences.en: He was somewhat pompous and had a high opinion of his own capabilities.
He was very pompous at the meeting.
sentences.cn: 他在会上表现得很自负.

sentences.en: He's a real gentleman, if a little pompous at times.
sentences.cn: 他可是个正人君子, 虽然有时略显得傲慢了些.

sentences.en: His idea of the art was that it involved something more pompous.
sentences.cn: 他对戏剧艺术的看法认为艺术包含着某种更为浮夸的东西.

sentences.en: Life is not composed by aphorism, how can we decorate it with pompous cliche & 1 & s? I send you my most sincere greeting in silence.
sentences.cn: 人生并非格言组成,岂能靠美丽的 辞章 来妆点, 默默中,有我对你最诚挚的祝福.

sentences.en: Mr Collins is a conceited, pompous, narrow - minded, silly man.
sentences.cn: 柯林斯先生是个自高自大, 喜爱炫耀 、 心胸狭窄的蠢汉.

sentences.en: Nothing could deflate his ego / pomposity , ie make him less self - assured or pompous.
sentences.cn: 任何事都不能削弱他的自信心[气焰].

sentences.en: The prose of his official communications was so laboured, pompous and verbose.
sentences.cn: 他笔下的公文矫揉浮华，长篇大论。

sentences.en: The service was grand without being pompous.
sentences.cn: 仪式场面宏大，却不浮华。

sentences.en: What a load of pompous, pseudo-intellectual rot.
sentences.cn: 真是自命不凡的伪知识分子的一派胡言！

words.tran_cn: 自大的；浮夸的；华而不实的；爱炫耀的

trans.tran_cn: 浮华的，华而不实的，高傲的，自大的
trans.tran_en: someone who is pompous thinks that they are important, and shows this by being very formal and using long words – used to show disapproval
